intro: Dichanthelium laxiflorum, commonly known as the slenderflower panicgrass, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, spikelet-bearing inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist to saturated soil conditions. Its flowering period occurs during the late spring to early summer, and it produces small, white or pale blue flowers. Dichanthelium laxiflorum plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
